entry.title: SPFRESH, Incremental In-Place Update for Billion-Scale Vector Search
entry.content:
Overview

  As the amount of vector data grows continously, it becomes important to supprt updates to vector index. To amortize costs, most existing systems maintain a secondary index to accumulate updates(OUT-OF-PLACE-UPDATE), which are merged with the main index by globally rebuilding the entire index periodically, e.g.,Vearch[2] and Miluvs[3]. However, this approach has high fluctuations of seach latency and accuracy, not to mention that it requires substantial resources and is extremely time-consuming to rebuild.
  This paper introduces SPFRESHSPF_{RESH}SPFRESH​, which supports incremental in-place update for billion-scale vector search and implements LIRE, a Lightweight Incremental RE-balancing protocol to split overly large postings and reassign vectors across neighboring postings when necessary. In short, SPR_RESH is a disk-based and cluster-based vector index that supports lightweight incremental in-place updates without the need for global rebuild to adapt to the data distrbution shift.

Details

Cluster-based vector indices

  Cluster-based vector indices organize vector indices via clustering, where vectors in close proximity are kept in the same partition(IVF).These indices are firendly to updates because each vector insertion or deletion only involves local modifications of vector data in the corresponding partition. However, a native update on partitions may eventually lead to imbalanced clusters and consequently deteriorate search tail latency and accuracy.
  A key property of a well-partitioned vector index is the nearest partition assignment(NPA):each vector should be put into the nearest posting so that it can be represented by the posting centroid. In a cluster-based vector index, we may violate the NPA property of the index if we directly split the posting list whose length is beyond the maxinum-length-threshold.

SPANN

  LIRE is built on SPANN, a billion-scale cluster-based vector index optimized for secondary storage. It stores the vectors as a huge number of postings’ on disk, each represents a cluster of close-by vectors. Moreover, SPANN origanizes a graph-based in-memory index, SPTAG, for the centroids of all postings, to quickly identify relevant postings for a query.
  For a query, if first identifies the closet posting centroids through the in-memory index, and then loads the corresponding postings from the dis to memory for further search.

LIRE Protocol

  The core of SPFRESHSPF_{RESH}SPFRESH​ is LIRE, a Lightweight Incremental Rebalancing protocol that accumulate small vector updates of local vector partitions, and re-balances local data distribution at a low cost. LIRE is capable of maintaining index quality by fixing data distribution abnormalities locally on-the-fly and consists of the following basic operations:

  1. Insert & Delete: LIRE directly inserts a new vector to the nearest partition foloowing the original SPANN index design. It ensures the deleted vectors will not appear in the search results and will eventually be removed from the corresponding postings.
  2. Split: When a posting exceeds a length limit, LIRE evenly splits the oversized posting into two samller ones and a reassign process will be trigered for the vectors in the split postings as well as nearby postings.
  3. Merge: When a posting size is smaller than a lower threshold, LIRE identifies its nearest posting as candidates for merging. After it, a reassign process will also be trigered beacause the deletion of the old centroid might break the NPS rule after being merged with the other posting.[ we also need to prove that such split-reassignment process will always converage]
  4. Reassigning Vectors: For a merge process, only vectors from deleted posting require reassignment because the deletion of a centroid does not break NPA compliance of vectors from undeleted postings. On the other hand, a split not only deletes a centroid but also creates tow ones. Therefore a split creates more complex scenarios of potential NPA violations. So the paper drives two necessary conditions for reassignment after splitting:
      a vector vvv in the old posting with centroid AoA_{o}Ao​ is required to consider being reassigned if:

D(v,ao)≤D(v,ai),∀i∈1,2D(v,a_o) \leq D(v,a_i),\forall i \in {1,2}D(v,ao​)≤D(v,ai​),∀i∈1,2

  where D denotes the distance, AoA_{o}Ao​ represents the old centroid before spliting, and AiA_{i}Ai​ represents any of two new centroids. This condition means that if the old centroid is the closest centroid to the vector compared to new centroids then it cannot be ruled out the possibility that vvv is closer to a centroid of some nearby posting than new centroids.
  a vector vvv in the nearby posting with centroid BBB needs to consider being reassigned if:

D(v,Ai)≤D(v,Ao),∃i∈1,2D(v,A_i) \leq D(v,A_o),\exists i \in {1,2}D(v,Ai​)≤D(v,Ao​),∃i∈1,2

  This condition suggests vvv’s new beighboring centroids are getting closer than the old one. Therefore it’s necessay to check if the new and closer centroids are in fact closer than v’s existing centroid.
  According to the two conditions, a complete checking rocess would be extremely expensive. To minimize the cost, LIRE only examines neraby postings for reassignment check by selecting several AoA_{o}Ao​'s nearest postings.

SPF_RESH Design and Implementation

   SPFRESHSPF_{RESH}SPFRESH​ reuses the SPANN SPTAG index for fast posting centroid navigation as well as its searcher to serve queries and further introduces three new moldues( Upddater, Rebuilder, Block-Controller) to implete LIRE

Updater

  Updater appends a new vector at the tail of its nearest posting and maintains a new version map to keep track of vector deletion by setting a corresponding tombstone version. The map is also used yo trace the replica of each vector. By increasing the the versio number, it marks the old replicas as deleted(System keeps a global in-memory version map and store vectors along with the version number on disk. A vector is stale if the in-memory version number is greater than that on the disk). After insertions are completed inplace, the Updater check the length of the posting and then sends a split job to Local-Rebuilde if the length exceeds the split limit.

Local Rebuilder

  Local Rebuilder maintains a job queue for split(triggered by Updater), merge(triggered by Searcher when searching), and reassign(triggered by Split and Merge operation) jobs and dispatches jobs to multiple background threads.
  A Reassign job checks if vectors in the new postings and/or their neighbors need to be relocated yo re-balance the data distributions the local region based on the two necessary condition listed above. Reassigning a vector without deleting its replicas in the unexamined postings increases the replica number.[concurrent control is aslo worth learning, but not metioned here]

Block Controller

  Block Controller serves posting read, write, and append requests, as well as posting insertion and deletion operators on disk. It maintains an in-memory mapping from the posting ID to its used SSD blocks as well as the free SSD blocks pool. It offers append-only operation on postings to take advantage of the characteristics of postings and operates directly on raw SSD interfaces.[blocks management is worth learning, refer to the original paper for more details]

Crash Recovery

  SPFRESHSPF_{RESH}SPFRESH​ combines snapshot(both in-memory and on-disk data structures) and WAL for crash safety. An index snapshot is taken periodically, and update request between adjacent snapshots are collected into a WAL. The WAL will be deleted when a new snapshot is generated.

References

  1. XU Y, LIANG H, LI J, 等. SPFresh: Incremental In-Place Update for Billion-Scale Vector Search[C/OL]//Proceedings of the 29th Symposium on Operating Systems Principles. 2023: 545-561[2025-03-18]. http://arxiv.org/abs/2410.14452.
  2. LI J, LIU H, GUI C, 等. The Design and Implementation of a Real Time Visual Search System on JD E-commerce Platform[C/OL]//Proceedings of the 19th International Middleware Conference Industry. Rennes France: ACM, 2018: 9-16[2025-02-03]. https://dl.acm.org/doi/10.1145/3284028.3284030.
  3. WANG J, YI X, GUO R, 等. Milvus: A Purpose-Built Vector Data Management System[C/OL]//Proceedings of the 2021 International Conference on Management of Data. Virtual Event China: ACM, 2021: 2614-2627[2025-03-16]. https://dl.acm.org/doi/10.1145/3448016.3457550.

entry.title: Optimized Product Quantization for Approximate Nearest Neighbor Search
entry.content:
Overview

Space decomposition has been shown to have great impact on the search accuracy in Product-Quantiztion. In this paper, we optimize product quantization by minimizing quantization distortions with respect to the space decomposition and the quantization codebooks.

Details

Vector Distortion

  Vector quantization maps a vector x∈RDx\in R^{D}x∈RD to a codeword ccc in a codebook C={c(i)}C=\{c(i)\}C={c(i)} with i in a finite index set, where the function i(⋅)i(·)i(⋅) is called an encoder, and the function c(⋅)c(·)c(⋅) is called a decoder.
  The quantization distortion E is defined as:

E=1n∑x∥x−c(i(x))∥2E = \frac{1}{n} \sum_{\mathbf{x}} \|\mathbf{x} - \mathbf{c}(i(\mathbf{x}))\|^2E=n1​x∑​∥x−c(i(x))∥2

  where ∣∣⋅∣∣||·||∣∣⋅∣∣ denotes the l2−norml_{2}-norml2​−norm, n is the total number of data samples, and the summation is over all the points in the given sample set.
  Product quantization involves decomposing the D-dimensional vector space into M subspaces, and computing a sub-codebook for each subspace. M is determined by the budget constraint of memory space and the computational cost, and is predertermined in practice. We use an orthonnormal matrix R to represent the space decomposition by which the D-dimensional vector space is first transformed.
  Therefore, the free parameters of product quantization consist of sub-codebooks for the subspaces and the matrix R. We optimize product quantization to minimize distortion over these free paramenters:

min⁡R,C1,…,CM∑x∥x−c(i(x))∥2,(4)\min_{R,\mathbf{C}^1,\ldots,\mathbf{C}^M} \sum_{\mathbf{x}} \|\mathbf{x} - \mathbf{c}(i(\mathbf{x}))\|^2, \quad (4) \\R,C1,…,CMmin​x∑​∥x−c(i(x))∥2,(4)

s.t. c∈C={c∣Rc∈C1×…×CM, RTR=I}s.t.\ \mathbf{c} \in \mathcal{C} = \{\mathbf{c} \mid R\mathbf{c} \in \mathbf{C}^1 \times \ldots \times \mathbf{C}^M, \ R^{\mathrm{T}}R = I\}s.t. c∈C={c∣Rc∈C1×…×CM, RTR=I}

A Non-Parameter Solution

基本思想：无需假设数据分布，交替优化空间分解矩阵 R 和子码本
算法步骤：

  1. 随机初始化 R、子码本Cm{C^{m}}Cm、各个向量的索引im{i^{m}}im
  2. 固定 R 优化码本：将数据投影到 R 空间，对每个子空间独立运行 k-means 聚类，更新子码本
  3. 固定码本优化 R：将数据投影到当前子码本空间，通过正交普鲁克问题(Orthogonal Procrustes problem) 求解最优 R
  4. 重复步骤2-3，直到算法收敛

A Parametric Solution

Our parametric solution first computes the covariance matrix ∑\sum∑ of the data and use Eigenvalue Allocation to generate the orthonnormal matrix R,which determines the space decomposition. The data are then transformed by R. The original PQ algorithm is then performed on these transformed data.

基本思想：假设数据服从高斯分布，通过特征值分配平衡子空间的方差，最小化理论失真下界。
算法步骤：

  1. PCA对齐：对数据进行PCA变换，使各个维度独立
  2. 特征值排序：将特征值降序排序
  3. 特征值分配：将特征值依次分配到 M 个子空间，每个子空间包含D/MD/MD/M个特征值，确保各子空间的特征值乘积均衡(Sequentially pick out the largest eigenvalue and allocate it to the bucket having the minimum product of the eigenvalues in it unless the bucket is full)
  4. 生成空间分解矩阵 R：根据分配的特征值对应的主成分方向构建 R(The principle directions corresponding to the eigenvalues in each bucket form the subspace)

References

[1] GE T, HE K, KE Q, 等. Optimized Product Quantization for Approximate Nearest Neighbor Search[C/OL]//2013 IEEE Conference on Computer Vision and Pattern Recognition. Portland, OR, USA: IEEE, 2013: 2946-2953[2025-03-11]. http://ieeexplore.ieee.org/document/6619223/.
[2] Yong Yuan’s Blob: 图像检索 OPQ索引和HNSW索引

entry.title: Product quantization for nearest neighbor search
entry.content:
Overview

The idea is to decompose the space into a Cartesian product of low dimensional subspaces and to quantize each subspace separately. A vector is represented by a short code composed of its subspace quantization indices

Details

Vector quantization

Quantization is a destructive process whose purpose is to reduce the cardinality of the representation space. Formally, a quantizer is a function q mapping a D-dimensional vector x∈RDx\in R^{D}x∈RD to a vector q(x)∈C={ci;i∈T}q(x)\in C=\{c_i;i\in T\}q(x)∈C={ci​;i∈T}, where the index set T is to be finite: T=0...k−1T=0...k-1T=0...k−1. The reproduction values cic_{i}ci​ are called centroids. The set of reproduction values C is the codebook of size k.
The set ViV_{i}Vi​ of vectors mapped to a given index i is rederred to a (Voronoi) cell and defined as: Vi≜{x∈RD:q(x)=ci}V_i \triangleq \{x \in \mathbb{R}^D : q(x) = c_i\}Vi​≜{x∈RD:q(x)=ci​}

Product quantizers

motivation

Let us consider a 128-dimensional vector, a quantizer producing 64-bits codes will actually contain k=264k=2^{64}k=264 centroids. Howerver, it’s impossible to use Lloyd’s algorithm or even HKM, as the number of samples required and the complexity of learning the quantizer are serveral times k. It’s also impossible to store the D×kD\times kD×k floating point values representing the k centroids.

methodology

in PQ,the input vector xxx is split into m distinct subvectors uju_{j}uj​, and the subvectors are quantized separately using m distinct quantizers:

search with quantizaion

the artical proposed two methos:

  1. Symmetric distance computation(SDC):both the query-vector x and database vector y are represented by their respective centroids q(x) and q(y)
  2. Asymetric distance computation(ADC):the database vector y is represented by q(y), but the query vector is not encoded

(usually ADC is preferred for accuracy. And we will use a pre-calculated distcance lookup table for accerlation [ref-2 for detail] )

IVF-PQ/IVF-ADC

To avoid exhaustive neighbor search, this method combines an inverted file system with the ADC, which allows rapid access to a small fraction of possible database vectors:

  • firstly, a codebook is learned using k-means, producing a quantizer qcq_{c}qc​ referred to as the coarse quantizer. It is used to determine which inverted list a databsed vector belongs to
  • in addition to the coarse quantizer, the description of a vector yyy is refined by a code obtained with a product quantizer which quantizes the residual vector of the original vector: r(y)=y−qc(y)r(y)=y-q_{c}(y)r(y)=y−qc​(y)
  • usually, we will probe multiple invertd lists instead of one when find the nearest neighbor of a query vetor to improve accuracy

References

  1. JÉGOU H, DOUZE M, SCHMID C. Product Quantization for Nearest Neighbor Search[J]. IEEE Transactions on Pattern Analysis and Machine Intelligence, 2011, 33(1): 117-128.
  2. Towards data sicence: Product Quantization for similarity Search

entry.title: Billion-Scale Similarity Search Using a Hybrid Indexing Approach with Advanced Filtering
entry.content:
Overview

Our approach extends the classical IVF-FLAT structure by introduction hybrid vectors that integrate dense embeddings and discrete filtering attributes.

对于向量数据和标量数据的混合过滤检索，一般会将标量数据和向量数据分开存储和索引，然后在混合检索时候采用 pre-filtering 或 post-filtering 处理策略。
本文提出了一种混合索引方案，将标量数据转化后得到的 Attribute Vector, 和向量原数据 Core Vector 拼接形成 Hybrid Vector 进行统一存储和索引。

Detail

Concepts

  • Core Vector: The orignal, raw, high-dimensional vector representation of the data point
  • Attribute Vector: Represents the discrete filtering attributes assiciated with each data point
  • Hybrid Vector: The concatenation of the core vector and the attribute vector
  • Query Vector: Represents the search query,which is also a hybrid vector, a result from the concatenation from the core search vector and the search filtering attributes

The Attribute vectors are generated to simulate realistic metadata while mataining a controlled environment. Each dimension of the attribute vector is assigned a random integer value drawn from a uniform distribution.

Hybrid Index Construction

混合索引的结构整体上继承了 IVF-FLAT 的思想，通过 K-Means / MiniBatchKMeans 聚类得到 K 个聚类中心后，根据每个 Hybrid Vector 的 Core Vector 部分与聚类中心的距离，将拼接后的混合向量存进与之最近的聚类中心对应的的链表中

Search

Query Vector(qh=[xinput∣∣ainput]q_h=[x_{input} || a_{input}]qh​=[xinput​∣∣ainput​])

  1. 根据混合查询向量中的原始向量 xinputx_{input}xinput​ 部分选出索引中与之最相近的 T 个聚类中心（所有聚类中心保留在内存中）
  2. 从磁盘加载 T 个聚类中心对应的链表进内存，根据混合向量中的属性向量 ainputa_{input}ainput​ 部分过滤掉不和要求的若干向量（按需将链表加载进入内存，降低内存开销）
  3. 对于过滤后得到的每个向量，计算其原始 Core Vector 部分和 xinputx_{input}xinput​ 之间的距离。最后归并得到 top-K 个相似的向量结果

Future Directions

  1. disk-based storage strategy with intelligent caching
  2. adapative methods for determing K and T based on dataset characteristics, query patterns, and filter selectivity
  3. parallel / distributed access improvements
  4. attribute compression methos

Reference

  • EMANUILOV S, DIMOV A. Billion-Scale Similarity Search Using a Hybrid Indexing Approach with Advanced Filtering[J]. Cybernetics and Information Technologies, 2024, 24(4): 45-58.
